intro: Beadlea bidentata, commonly known as the two-toothed beadlea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive two-toothed bracts on its inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Beadlea bidentata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and vibrant blooms.
